result.markdown:
--- title: Simple R Intro title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: /img/coding.png background-opacity: "0.45" format: revealjs: chalkboard: true --- ## [RStudio]{style="color:green;"} ![](../img/RStudio1.png) ## [RStudio]{style="color:green;"} ![](../img/RStudio2.png) ## [Installing Packages]{style="color:green;"} ![](../img/RStudio4.png) ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} . . . ### [**Objects**]{style="color:blue;"} A storage place for information; stored in the "Environment"
::: fragment *'Attributes'* describes the structure or information of the object ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ### [**Objects**]{style="color:blue;"} ![](../img/RStudio3.png) ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ### [**Objects**]{style="color:blue;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # y is an 'object' that is assigned the value 3 y = 3 y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3 ``` ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Same operation '=' '<-' y <- 3 ``` ::: ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ### [**Objects**]{style="color:blue;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # We can create new objects from objects y2 = y-2 y2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1 ``` ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # We can do math with our objects # Mind your parentheses (order of operation) y*2 / y*4 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 8 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} y*2 / (y*4) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0.5 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ### [**Functions**]{style="color:blue;"} 'does stuff'; creates or manipulates objects ::: fragment *'Arguments'* are the types of things a function is asking for; the inputs ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} [**object**]{style="color:orange;"} = [function]{style="color:blue;"}([argument]{style="color:purple;"} = input1, [argument]{style="color:purple;"} = input2)
. . . [**object**]{style="color:orange;"} = [function]{style="color:blue;"}(input1, input2)
. . . [**this**]{style="color:orange;"} = [sign]{style="color:blue;"}([x]{style="color:purple;"} = -5)
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sign(-5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] -1 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sign(5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} {.scrollable} ### [**Functions**]{style="color:blue;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # function - 'c' - concatenate y = c(1,2,3,4,5,6) ``` :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} is.numeric(y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # The function 'class' has the argument 'x' is.numeric(x = y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ### [**Functions**]{style="color:blue;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # How to find out the arguments of a function? ?is.numeric ``` ::: ![](../img/is.numeric.png) ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ### Wrapping functions ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Functions are commonly 1) wrapped, 2) have multiple arguments x = matrix( data = c(1,2,3,4,5,6), nrow = 2, ncol = 3 ) ``` ::: ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [,1] [,2] [,3] [1,] 1 3 5 [2,] 2 4 6 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [The language of R]{style="color:green;"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} **Values** - numeric - integer - character - factor ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} **Objects** - vector - matrix - array - list - dataframe - [S3, S4, S5, and beyond ]{style="color:purple;"} ::: ::: ## [Types of Values]{style="color:green;"} {.scrollable} ### Numeric ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} y = 3 class(y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "numeric" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ### Integer ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} y = integer(3) class(y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "integer" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ### Character ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} y = "habitat" class(y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "character" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ### Factor ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} y = factor("habitat") class(y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "factor" ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"} {.scrollable} ### Vector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # An ordered collection indexed 1,2,...n # Using the function 'c' to concetanate z1 = c(4,5,6) z1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 4 5 6 ``` ::: ::: The value 4 is in element/index/position 1 of the vector The value 6 is in element/index/position 3 of the vector
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # the dimension of a vector length(z1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3 ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # A vector of characters z2 = c("dog","cat","horse") z2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "dog" "cat" "horse" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z3 = c("dog","1","horse") z3 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "dog" "1" "horse" ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Subsetting a vector ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z3 = c("dog", "1", "horse", "chicken" ) z3[2] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "1" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} 2:4 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2 3 4 ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z3[2:4] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "1" "horse" "chicken" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z3[c(2,4)] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "1" "chicken" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z3[-1] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "1" "horse" "chicken" ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Vector of factors ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z4 = factor( c("dog", "dog", "cat", "horse" ) ) ``` ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z4 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] dog dog cat horse Levels: cat dog horse ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} levels(z4) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "cat" "dog" "horse" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(z4) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` cat dog horse 1 2 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Matrix ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x = matrix( c(1,2,3,4,5,6), nrow = 2, ncol = 3 ) ``` ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [,1] [,2] [,3] [1,] 1 3 5 [2,] 2 4 6 ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #rows and columns dim(x) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2 3 ``` ::: ::: :::
## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Subsetting a matrix ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # get element of row 1 and column 2 x[1,2] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3 ``` ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # get all elements of row 2 x[2,] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2 4 6 ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # same as x[2,1:3] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2 4 6 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Array ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # ARRAY - more than two dimensions z5 = array( c("a","b","c","d","1","2","3","4"), dim = c(2,2,2) ) ``` :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} z5 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` , , 1 [,1] [,2] [1,] "a" "c" [2,] "b" "d" , , 2 [,1] [,2] [1,] "1" "3" [2,] "2" "4" ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### List ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # LIST - a bucket - will take anything my.list = list(z1, z2, z3, z4, z5) ``` ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Subset a list my.list[[1]] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 4 5 6 ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} my.list[[4]] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] dog dog cat horse Levels: cat dog horse ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Data frame E.g., a row for each observation and a column for each variable (can be different types). ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x = data.frame(outcome = c(1,0,1,1), exposure = c("yes", "yes", "no", "no"), age = c(24, 55, 39, 18) ) x ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` outcome exposure age 1 1 yes 24 2 0 yes 55 3 1 no 39 4 1 no 18 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## [Types of Objects]{style="color:green;"}{.scrollable} ### Subset data.frame ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x$exposure ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "yes" "yes" "no" "no" ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x['exposure'] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` exposure 1 yes 2 yes 3 no 4 no ``` ::: ::: :::
::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x[,2] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "yes" "yes" "no" "no" ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.cell} :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
